text:
Ananta Charan Sukla (6 November 1942 – 1 October 2020) was an Indian educator, philosopher and historian. He was a professor of English and Comparative Literature at Sambalpur University. He was born in Odisha, India. Sukla was the founding editor of the international half-yearly "Journal of Comparative Literature and Aesthetics".
Sukla died on 1 October 2020 in Odisha from multiple organ failure at the age of 77.
